DataElement.preferredName: Person Medical Clearance Immunotherapy Administration And Post Surgery Imaging Confirmed Measurable Residual Disease Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation, as outlined in the study protocol, to address the medical clearance for the administration of immunotherapeutic agents, and the confirmation of measurable residual disease by post-surgery imagining procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Medical Clearance Immunotherapeutic Agent Administration And Post Surgical Procedure Imaging Technique Confirmation Measurable Residual Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Written permission from a medical professional stating that an individual is healthy enough to participate in a specific activity._Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Having been established or verified._Capable of being measured._Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Medical Clearance Immunotherapeutic Agent Administration And Post Surgical Procedure Imaging Technique Confirmation Measurable Residual Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Written permission from a medical professional stating that an individual is healthy enough to participate in a specific activity.:Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Having been established or verified.:Capable of being measured.:Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Written permission from a medical professional stating that an individual is healthy enough to participate in a specific activity.
Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient been cleared
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been cleared for bevacizumab administration with respect to any recent surgeries, and post-surgical scans must confirm the presence of measurable residual disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been cleared for bevacizumab administration with respect to any recent surgeries, and do post surgical scans confirm the presence of measurable residual disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been cleared for administration of bevacizumab or its biosimilars with respect to any recent surgeries, and do post surgical scans confirm the presence of measurable residual disease?

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
